incidents.name: Rare occurrences of duplicate sentences in Voice Intelligence transcripts

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing failure that impacts a small number of transcripts created since 02/18/2025 where customers may have received duplicate sentences in their transcript results. Our engineers fixed all transcripts created during this period. This incident has been resolved.

Twilio Voice Intelligence engineering team is investigating a condition that impacts a small number of transcripts created since 02/18/2025. During this period of time customers may have received duplicate sentences in their transcript results if they have multiple operator results for that sentence. Our engineers are working to resolve the issue. The fix will apply to all transcripts created during this period. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue Sentences and results are being duplicated in Transcript objects. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: 5xx Responses Using Programmable Messaging API

incident_updates.body: The Twilio Programmable Messaging API was partially degraded for 1 minute between 05:01 to 05:02 Pacific Time on 03/17/2025. During this period of time, customers sending messages may have received 5xx's in API responses or experienced brief delays (less than 15 seconds) with message sending. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Incorrect Data on Deactivations API for 2025-03-05

incident_updates.body:
Twilio has identified a large number of incorrect entries in the Deactivation API for March 5th, 2025. We are working with the carrier to identify the corrected list. To avoid further customer impact, we have removed the incorrect file until we can replace it with a corrected one. 

When querying 2025-03-05 on the Deactivations API, you will receive a 20404 error response.

incidents.name: Intermittent SMS/MMS Deliverability Issues to AT&T Due to Incorrect Deactivation Data

incident_updates.body: Twilio experienced degraded service on a subset of US short codes for approximately 48 hours between March 5th and March 7th, 2025. During this period, customers may have experienced message delivery failures to AT&T numbers due to certain numbers being incorrectly marked as deactivated in the operator’s data file. The issue has been resolved as of March 7th at 13:34 UTC.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with number deactivation. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Console not Taking Account Upgrade After Being Completed

incident_updates.body: The issue pertaining to the Twilio Console upgrade flow has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

A fix has been deployed to address this issue, and our Engineering team is currently monitoring the results. We will provide another update within 2 hours or as soon as we have additional information.

Our engineers have identified an issue with the upgrade flow in Console where customers still see the "Upgrade" button available after completing the upgrade of the account and are working to deploy a fix. As a workaround, customers can do a hard refresh in the browser and then the console will reflect the upgraded state. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified an issue with the upgrade flow in Console where customers still see the "Upgrade" button available after completing the upgrade of the account and are working to deploy a fix. As a workaround, customers can do a hard refresh in the browser and then the console will reflect the upgraded state. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Callback Failures That are Affecting Voice Calls and Video Customers

incident_updates.body: Twilio callback-service was degraded for 43 minutes between 03:18 and 04:01 Pacific Time on 03/11/2025. During this period of time customers may have experienced failed webhook callbacks for a small percentage (<1%) of their calls or videos. The issue has now been mitigated, while the team continues root cause investigation.
